intro: Metastelma guanchezii, commonly known as the Canary Island spider plant, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and clusters of small, white or pale green flowers. The plant is typically found in rocky or coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its unique appearance and adaptability to arid conditions make it a notable species in its native habitat.
